abstracts.cdata!:
The project comprises the following: (A)
            a petroleum exploration promotion component that includes:
            (i) consultant services for compiling existing geophysical
            data, analyzing seismic and well data, carrying out
            geological studies, preparing documents, including
            demarcation of blocks for leasing, and presenting proposals
            for negotiation with interested companies, advising Guyanese
            negotiators and assisting the Government in formulating its
            draft petroleum act and regulations; (ii) technical
            assistance for establishing a professional management group
            to oversee exploration activities and for installing
            procedures for petroleum accounting; (iii) training of local
            staff in petroleum exploration techniques and university
            training in geology/geophysics for three staff members; and
            (iv) purchase of a vehicle and office and laboratory
            equipment and materials; and (B) a heavy oil potential
            evaluation component that includes a gravity/magnetic
            survey, shallow exploration drilling and consultant services
            to determine the extent of heavy oil deposits in the eastern
            coastal area.
